"Most of it is cosmetic, but we had to procure some replacement parts 
for the engine and a couple of minor systems." Devilcat 
explains.  "Now it's just a matter of time.  Speaking of which, I 
ought to check on them."  The Rogue commander keys his comlink.

"Devilcat to base, report!"

"Hey boss, it's Fury.  They're just about finished down back."

"Excellent, excellent.  I've hammered out a treaty of sorts with the 
Maximals.  What's the Predacon base look like?"

"Like a tomb - nothing's happened except a few scouts going out."

"Probably means they're up to something.  If you see any movement, 
update me at once."

"Right, boss!"  Fury breaks the link.

Devilcat looks at Yggdrasil.  "Well, I suppose that answers your 
question."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
<wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Yggdrasil: That could be a good idea. It will all depend on how the
> Tripreds want to act it out also, on their strategy. Can your tell 
me
> what damages your ship suffers and how long it will be until it's
> repaired? 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > "That will not be an issue once Rogue Star is repaired." Devilcat 
> > says confidently.  "It may be smaller than a battlecruiser, but 
it's 
> > much faster and its armament and shields are roughly on a par 
with 
> > the Tripred ship.  If we can bring it into play, their firepower 
> > advantage will be negated.  And its cloaking ability is quite 
useful 
> > for setting traps."  Devilcat smiles as an idea strikes 
him.  "That 
> > could be used to our advantage here as well.  If the enemy comes 
> > expecting the defense capabilities of one starship and they are 
met 
> > with two, it will make a mess of their attack plans.  Too bad it 
> > would only work once."
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Yggdrasil nods hesitatingly.
> > > 
> > > Yggdrasil: Establishing a good defense would allow our forces to
> > > destroy any attackers, but we would then need to root them out,
> > > whoever attacks first. In this case, The maximals could hold 
the 
> > line
> > > here while the Rogues go and destroy the remaining attackers at 
> > their
> > > base. The preds tend to strike with all forces, but I don't 
know 
> > about
> > > the Tripreds. Besides, their ship seemed to be quite well 
defended.
> > > That would be very hard.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > "I understand that the Tripreds are much more dangerous," 
> > Devilcat 
> > > > points out.  "But harsh experience has taught me never to 
> > discount an 
> > > > opposing force, no matter how weak it may seem.  If we focus 
all 
> > our 
> > > > attention on the Tripredacus forces, Hydras is free to strike 
as 
> > he 
> > > > chooses.  And I know from doing it myself how devastating 
that 
> > tactic 
> > > > is when done properly.  A better plan would be to wait for 
one or 
> > the 
> > > > other to make a move, then counter it."
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > > > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Yggdrasil: Alright, but remember I have to talk to you as 
one 
> > > > officer
> > > > > to another.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Yggdrasil looked at Devilcat.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Yggdrasil: I don't want the Tripreds to take hold here, but 
I 
> > hope 
> > > > you
> > > > > see why they are the real threat, not the Preds.
> > > > >

<roborick007@y...> 
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > >

> > > > > > Rodimus gets up, looking to the guests on the otherside 
of 
> > his 
> > > > desk.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Rodimus Prime: If you'll excuse me, I have to go deal 
with 
> > this 
> > > > pod
> > > > > problem. If you need anything just contact Kup over the 
base 
> > comm
> > > > > system. He'll see that you get quarters or anything else 
you 
> > need.

He 
> > opens 
> > > > a
> > > > > comm to Rattrap.

Let's
